definition: stick/club/cudgel/smart/capable/strong/wonderful/classifier for legs of a relay race

sentences.english: We order this brand of light stick because of its quality.
sentences.chinese: 我們購買該品牌的熒光棒是因爲它的質量。

sentences.english: Collection of light sticks will be on the day of the concert. Payment will also be made then.
sentences.chinese: 熒光棒將於演唱會當天派發給會員，並在當天付費。

sentences.english: Glow sticks are used as lures for catching swordfish.
sentences.chinese: 熒光棒可以用於捕抓劍魚的誘餌。

sentences.english: They can also be used by hunters and paintball players.
sentences.chinese: 熒光棒也常被獵人或者野戰愛好者使用。

sentences.english: The colored sticks glowed in the darkness of the playground.
sentences.chinese: 熒光棒在黑漆漆的操場上發着光。

sentences.english: Waved light sticks non - stop on - site, continuous applause.
sentences.chinese: 現場熒光棒揮舞不停，掌聲不斷。

sentences.english: We don't know the price of other light sticks in the market.
sentences.chinese: 我們並不清楚其他熒光棒的價格。

definition: alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
a form of theatrical double act in which one performer speaks or sings while the other, in front, pretends to be doing the speaking or singing/double reed (as in an oboe or bassoon)
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
car show girl/model who poses next to cars
